casebody.data:
OLD DOMINION STEAMSHIP COMPANY, Appellant, v. UNITED STATES, Appellee. (Circuit Court of Appeals, Fourth Circuit. January 13, 1925.) No. 2291. Emory H. Niles, of Baltimore, Md. (George S. Yost and Niles, Wolff, Barton & Morrow, all of Baltimore, Md., and Root, Clark, Buckner & Howland, of New York City, on the brief), for appellant. Arthur M. Boal, Asst. Admiralty Counsel, U. S. Shipping Board, of Washington, D. O. (A. W. W. Woodcock, U. S. Atty., of Baltimore, Md., on the brief), for the United States.

Before WOODS, WADDILL, and ROSE, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM.

The decree of the District Court (297 F. 534) is affirmed, on the authority of United States v. Carver, 260 U. S. 482, 43 S. Ct. 181, 67 L. Ed. 361, and the decisions of this court in Gill v. United States (Sept. 29, 1924) 1 F.(2d) 964, Frey v. United States (Sept. 29, 1924) 1 F.(2d) 963, and Standard Oil Co. v. United States (Sept. 29, 1924) 1 F. (2d) 961. Affirmed.
